title: Liverpool legend Steve Nicol says Reds' leaky defence will cost them shot at Premier League title
text:

Liverpool will not win the Premier League title this season - and their leaky defence is to blame. 
That is the view of Reds legend Steve Nicol, who doesn't think the current backline is good enough to launch an assault on top spot. 
A shock defeat to Swansea on Saturday means Jurgen Klopp's side are now 10 points behind pace-setters Chelsea in the title race, and just two points ahead of Manchester City who currently occupy fifth spot. 
Liverpool have shipped 27 goals so far this term, 12 more than Antonio Conte's Blues, with only City and West Brom (28) having leaked more in the top eight. Klopp's side are 10 points off the pace (Photo: Getty) The defeat to Swansea leaves the Reds with just a two-point cushion over fifth-placed Man City (Photo: Getty) 
"I don't see Liverpool winning the Premier League title with the defence they have," Nicol told ESPN FC. 
"They don't look as if they are going to bring anyone in this window, which means they've got what they've got. View gallery 
"When they let in goals that they have done - not just at Swansea, against Burnley - [they are] perfect examples that it's not happening. 
"Bournemouth - four goals at Bournemouth. A team doesn't win the Premier League shipping goals in the way they do." 
Nicol played for Liverpool for 14 years, winning five league titles, three FA Cups and the European Cup. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
